intro: Tephrosia virens, commonly known as greenleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being elliptical and slightly hairy. The flowers are small, clustered in racemes, and range in color from white to pale yellow.
